title: Housing Options | Future Students | SF State
content:
Housing + Dining
Whether you are a freshman, transfer or grad student, there are a variety of housing options at San Francisco State University, all conveniently located close to your classes, the library, the bookstore, dining commons, and other campus resources. Living in campus housing is not only a great way to get involved, make connections, and share common interests with other members of your community, but research shows that you may even get better grades and graduate faster than students who live off campus.
Applying for Housing
The Housing Office highly recommends students submit their housing application as soon as the housing portal opens in order to increase their chances of obtaining a space and selecting your preferred room type.
For more information on how to apply, visit the
Housing website
.
Take a virtual tour of housing
.
Student with family? For more information on student family housing visit the
Employee & Family Housing website
.
Dining
A meal plan provides you with a variety of selections from multiple cuisine platforms at our residential dining commons and is a great way to ensure that you always have a nutritious meal. For more information about meal plans and to learn which residential communities have mandatory meal plans, visit
University Dining
.

title: Dining Services | University Housing | SF State
content:
Enjoy the Experience
Dining on campus means more than just great food. It‚Äôs a chance to recharge, catch up with friends, and have fun!
Dining Services
SF State Dining Services is dedicated to providing a community experience centered on culinary expertise along with a shared sense of environmental and social responsibility.¬†All food and dining services are provided by Sodexo.
ABOUT SODEXO
Sodexo purchases locally whenever possible for the freshest ingredients and source 100% sustainable seafood, eggs from cage-free chickens, and coffee. Learn more about Sodexo's
commitment to sustainability
.
Sodexo team members go through an award-winning training twice a year to ensure that the experiences that students have go above and beyond.
Learn More About Sodexo
Dining Locations
Our residential dining locations provide all-you-care-to-eat dine-in options or you can grab a snack, meal to-go or Starbuck beverages.
Monarca Dining Hall (Formerly City Eats)
Monarca Dining Hall is located in the Central Neighborhood next to Towers Junior Suites. [

Bring Your Appetite
Our residential dining locations provide well-balanced menu choices from a variety of cuisine platforms. Each food station* provides vegan and vegetarian options along with nutritional information and tips to help you make choices that fit your needs or special dietary requirements.
* Food stations vary by location.
One thing that really stands out about our campus dining is the fact that they really focus on our well-being. They focus on making healthy foods, with lots of nutrients and all kinds of dietary options. ~ Sarah (South Neighborhood)
Savory | Custom Kitchen
An entr√©e station where plates are made to order, highlighting the top-quality ingredients featured in the day‚Äôs menu.
Sizzle | Grill & Griddle
A classic diner-style grill station with a core menu of daily favorites and rotating limited-time options.
Mix | Salad Experience
A salad station with a variety of toppings that emphasizes fresh, seasonal and locally sourced ingredients.
Stacked | Deli Case
A station with freshly sliced meats, cheeses, crisp vegetables, and plant-based choices.
Grown | Plant-Based
This plant-based station offers a flavorful journey that's beneficial for your body, soul, and the planet!
Showcase | Flavor Destination
This station offers a diverse range of cuisines prepared and presented with flexibility.
Twists | Pasta Kitchen
A made-to-order pasta bar with a choice of fresh and delicious ingredients.
Bliss | The Sweet Spot
This station offers freshly baked goods and delightful treats.
Spoonfull | Hearty Bowls
Daily house made soups with all the fixings to either become a full meal or compliment a meal.
I Want To...
LEARN ABOUT MEAL PLANS
A meal plan is convenient, saves you time, and gives you the flexibility to choose from different dining platforms. You have a lot on your plate while you attend the university, so leave the shopping, cooking and dishes to us!
Meal Plan Information
STAY CONNECTED
Learn what‚Äôs on the menu each day, find nutrition information about your meal, and more with the Everyday App. Available for download at:
App Store
Google Play
GET INVOLVED
Join us for weekly and monthly special events and promotions, like cooking classes, restaurant style dining nights, and classic holiday feasts. Follow us on Instagram for event notifications and updates.
Visit SF State Dining Services on Instagram

title: About | University Housing
content:
About
Our Mission
University Housing supports the mission of the University by providing an educational living and learning environment which enhances the academic and co-curricular pursuits of our residents. The dialogue that exists between the collective residential community and the individuals who comprise and create the community, provides unique opportunities for growth with regard to multicultural competencies, respectful community living and leadership development.

title: Continuing Resident Housing Options | University Housing
content:
Continuing Resident Housing Options
Why Return to On-campus Housing
THE INDEPENDENCE
Continuing residents are eligible for apartment living options, so you‚Äôll have more space and independence.
THE COMMUNITY
Being part of a community where you feel a sense of belonging creates a foundation for personal growth and success.
THE SUPPORT
Another year living in an environment invested in your success and where you have easy access to campus resources.
THE CONVENIENCE
Why commute when you can stay close to all your classes, resources, your friends & campus events?
San Francisco State‚Äôs on-campus housing has a lot of benefits. It‚Äôs in a great location on campus, you're close to everything, and it‚Äôs just very convenient overall. ~Jake (Central Neighborhood)
Communities

title: Future Residents | University Housing | San Francisco State University
content:
Picture Yourself Here!
SF State‚Äôs residential communities are located in the quiet, southwestern corner of one of the most exciting, culturally rich, and picturesque cities in America.
Future Residents
Welcome to University Housing at SF State!
We are delighted that you are considering the San Francisco State Residential Community as your home while attending at the University. Our highest priority is to provide a safe and supportive living environment that fosters personal development and promotes academic success.
See Why SF State is the Perfect Place to Call Home!
SF State Housing Has...
3 Neighborhoods
7 Communities
1 Resident Assistant
to Every 35-55 Residents
Residential Life Staff Available
24/7
Why Live on Campus?
Living on campus offers numerous benefits that will help you make a smooth transition to college life and provide you with a greater overall satisfaction with your college experience. Some of the benefits are:
Living on campus provides a supportive environment and access to resources that will enhance your overall success as you pursue your academic interests. In fact, studies show that:
On average, freshmen who live on campus have a
higher GPA
and greater success in college than those who live off campus
.
Students that live on campus are able to take more units each semester and have a
higher 4-year graduation rate
.
When you live on campus, you won‚Äôt have extra expenses like utilities, maintenance, Wi-Fi, or furniture and you‚Äôll have access to services and resources that you may not have with off-campus housing.
Plus with classes, the library, bookstore, and other campus resources only steps away, you‚Äôll not only save on transportation expenses, but you‚Äôll spend less time in a car or on public transportation and have more time for classes, studying, socializing or relaxing.
Our residential communities have a network of support staff focused¬†on assisting residents so that they are successful both in and out of the¬†classroom.
Each residential community has a support desk and inhouse¬†student leaders committed to connecting you to resources and¬†opportunities that will help you make the most of your on-campus¬†experience. You won't have access to these resources and services if you live off campus.
There are hundreds¬†of ways to get¬†involved at SF¬†State, but living on¬†campus provides¬†you with even more¬†opportunities to¬†engage in campus¬†life.
Each residential community provides residents with¬†access to organizations, events. These opportunities allow you to enjoy new experiences, explore various interests, and connect you with others so you can build lasting friendships and maintain a¬†sense of belonging.
Being at school here has kept me really inspired. So I actually was able to keep a really high GPA while going here, and there‚Äôs so many resources on campus that really help me stay on track. ~ Sarah (South Neighborhood)

title: SF State starts construction for first-year residence hall to provide more affordable student housing | College of Liberal & Creative Arts
content:
SF State starts construction for first-year residence hall to provide more affordable student housing
Author:
SF State News
April 17, 2023
Photo Credit:
Courtesy of EHDD
San Francisco State University held a ceremony to celebrate the start of construction for the West Campus Green (WCG) project. The project includes a first-year residence hall that will add 750 affordable beds, a dining facility and a student health center. San Francisco State hired design-build team McCarthy Building Companies, Inc. and EHDD to deliver the project.
Read the entire story
.

title: SF State Proposal to Grow Student Housing Up for Public Review
content:
Thursday, July 21, 2016
SAN FRANCISCO EXAMINER -- San Francisco State University, a commuter school with a student body spread throughout the Bay Area, could triple student housing at certain sites along its southern border under a proposal up for public review this month. The proposal calls for the university to demolish two current on-campus housing sites and replace them over a two-year stretch with a mixed-use development, a new Creative Arts Building and an 800-seat concert hall. The proposal is part of a transformation the university campus has experienced in recent years, including a $2 million renovation of the campus gymnasium in 2014 and the construction of an $86.5 million wellness and recreation center that is slated for completion in 2017. Construction of the new Creative Arts Building and concert hall at Tapia Triangle is expected to begin in Fall 2017 and last two years. The mixed-use building would begin construction shortly thereafter and be completed in 2019.
Read the full story
Feed

title: SF State to Break Ground on New Student Housing, High-Tech Media Center in Fall
content:
Tuesday, May 01, 2018
SAN FRANCISCO EXAMINER -- Slated to rise simultaneously with the housing project is a long-awaited, state-of-the-art Center for Media Arts, which will come with an adjacent 800-seat auditorium at the intersection of Holloway Avenue and Font Boulevard.
The four-story, 76,000 square-foot building will absorb the school‚Äôs Broadcast and Electronic Communication Arts program, which currently operates inside of SFSU‚Äôs aging College of Liberal and Creative Arts Department building.
That department‚Äôs administrative offices, as well as interdisciplinary lecture and active learning classrooms, two full-height television studios, a television newsroom, a radio station and production spaces, will also find a home in the new center.
Read the full story
Feed

title: Alum Pam Dorr's Plan to Solve Bay Area Housing Problem: 10,000 Tiny, Backyard Homes
content:
Thursday, May 17, 2018
SAN JOSE MERCURY NEWS -- What do these two places have in common: Hale County, Alabama, one of the nation‚Äôs poorest communities, and Silicon Valley, one of the nation‚Äôs richest?
People can‚Äôt afford homes in either place, says Pam Dorr, director of affordable housing at Menlo Park-based nonprofit Soup.
That‚Äôs why after spending 15 years helping to produce affordable homes in Hale County, Dorr is bringing the lessons she learned in rural Alabama to the Bay Area, eager to try her hand at solving the region‚Äôs housing woes. Her goal is to build 10,000 homes in 10 years, by erecting prefabricated granny flats in backyards or on other unused parcels.
‚ÄúIf we think of each of us as being a partial solution to homelessness, it‚Äôs one way we can help,‚Äù she says.
Dorr received her bachelor‚Äôs degree in Liberal Studies from San Francisco State University.
Read the full story
Feed

title: Theatre Production Brings Housing Crisis Stories to Life
content:
Wednesday, December 07, 2016
GOLDEN GATE XPRESS -- A homeless wandering couch, played by theatre major Regina Leon, narrated, leading the audience through a series of stories about people affected by their gentrifying neighborhoods, accompanied by dance numbers and a live blues band. ‚ÄúI was born and raised in San Francisco, I‚Äôm from the Mission, I‚Äôm Latina and I identify with the couch in various ways,‚Äù Leon said. ‚ÄúI was surrounded by a lot of (different) people, and just like the couch, she pulls from all these stories from different people and she creates her own persona through all these experiences, and that‚Äôs how I did, too, for the couch.‚Äù The story of the couch was conceived by Conboy, one of seven playwrights who co-wrote the story. Leon‚Äôs narration as the couch is used as a ‚Äúdramatic device‚Äù to tell the various stories of the people it encountered.
Read the full story
Feed

title: Future Resident Housing Options | University Housing
content:
Future Resident Housing Options
San Francisco State‚Äôs residential communities are located in the quiet,¬†southwestern corner one of the most exciting, culturally rich, and¬†picturesque cities in America. Imagine, living just one mile from the Pacific¬†Ocean and only a short distance from all that San Francisco has to offer.
Whether you prefer traditional residence hall, suite, or apartment-style housing, SFSU has a variety of housing communities and room types. Whatever you‚Äôre looking for, we have a space that‚Äôs right for you.
Launch Experience
Accessible San Francisco State University - Housing Virtual Tour
Being on campus and experiencing that community life, especially here in a place like this, is something you definitely need for freshman students starting off college. To be able to come here and not feel like you‚Äôre alone and you actually have friends and a community here, it‚Äôs a very good feeling. ~Quentin (Central Neighborhood)
Neighborhoods & Communities
Housing options are based on availability and subject to change. Depending on availability, some applicants may be assigned to a community other than what's listed for their class type. Any applicant seeking a year-round license agreement will be assigned to
Manzanita Square
.

The communities in the Central Neighborhood place you in the heart of campus life. Not only will you be close to classes, dining, student resources and campus events, but you'll become part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you'll have plenty of opportunities to make friends and thrive both personally and academically.

The North Neighborhood is right next to campus and easily accessible using a short walking path. With campus resources, shops, restaurants, and public transportation nearby, you'll find the ideal balance of convenience and independence.

The South Neighborhood is located across the street from the main¬†campus in Parkmerced, a vibrant neighborhood surrounded by nature,¬†recreation, shopping, restaurants, and more.

title: Apply for On-Campus Housing | University Housing
content:
Apply for On-Campus Housing
Why Live on Campus
Guaranteed Housing
Reduced-Rate Student Housing Program
Steps to Apply for Housing
1 | Explore
2| Apply
3 | Receive
4 | Confirm
Additional Resources
Housing FAQs
Renters Insurance
Live Where Gators Thrive!
When you live on campus, you‚Äôll belong to a community where you‚Äôll find personal and academic support along with plenty of opportunities to make great friends and memorable experiences. Plus, you‚Äôll be just steps away from classes, resources and campus activities.
Learn More About the Benefits of Living on Campus
Freshmen...We Have Space for YOU!
Great news!
GUARANTEED
housing is available to all students who have submitted a 2025-2026 housing application along with their initial payment and who have accepted their admission offer.
Be sure to apply early so you'll have a better chance of receiving your preferred community and room type.
A Home to Fit Every Budget
With all of the benefits that on-campus housing has to offer, SF State strives to ensure that housing is accessible to all. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve allocated bedspaces at a reduced rate to eligible freshmen.
Find Out if You're Eligible
Steps to Apply for Housing
1 | Explore Housing Options & Fees
Launch Experience
Accessible San Francisco State University - Housing Virtual Tour
Find your new home!
Before you apply, take a virtual tour of our residential community and explore our available housing options. Once you've identified your preferred community and room type, review the associated housing fees and meal plan requirements for your selected community.
Future Resident Housing
Continuing Resident Housing

3 | Receive a Housing Reservation
Get ready to celebrate!
If a space has been reserved for you in housing, a notification will be sent to your SF State email account. You will receive your room and community information after you complete step 4 (spring and academic year applicants only).
